Package storage

Class SlottedPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • storage.SlottedPage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object>
    public class SlottedPage
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object>
    A SlottedPage can store objects of possibly different sizes in a byte array.
    Author:
    Jeong-Hyon Hwang (jhh@cs.albany.edu)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  SlottedPage.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      An IndexOutofBoundsException is thrown if an invalid index is used.
      class  SlottedPage.OverflowException
      A OverflowException is thrown if a SlottedPage cannot accommodate an additional object.

      Returns the size of free space in this SlottedPage.

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get​(int index)
                     throws SlottedPage.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Returns the object at the specified index in this SlottedPage (null if that object was removed from this SlottedPage).
        Parameters:
        index - an index
        Returns:
        the object at the specified index in this SlottedPage; null if that object was removed from this SlottedPage
        Throws:
        SlottedPage.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if an invalid index is given
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • put

        public java.lang.Object put​(int index,
                            java.lang.Object o)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            SlottedPage.OverflowException,
                            SlottedPage.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Puts the specified object at the specified index in this SlottedPage.
        Parameters:
        index - an index
        o - an object to add
        Returns:
        the object stored previously at the specified location in this SlottedPage; null if no such object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        SlottedPage.OverflowException - if this SlottedPage cannot accommodate the specified object
        SlottedPage.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if an invalid index is used

        Removes the object at the specified index from this SlottedPage.
        Parameters:
        index - an index within this SlottedPage
        Returns:
        the object stored previously at the specified location in this SlottedPage; null if no such object
        Throws:
        SlottedPage.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if an invalid index is used
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
